pageTitle: Aldine Independent School District Average Teacher Salary & How to Become a Teacher
textBeforeTable: The average teacher salary in Aldine Independent School District is $46,487. Average Teacher Salary in Aldine Independent School District Teacher Awards Resources Articles Blog Become a Teacher Average State Salary
textAfterTable: How to Become a Teacher in Aldine Independent School District To learn how to become a teacher in the Aldine Independent School District, read our how to become a teacher in Texas article. For average salary information, read our average teacher salary in Texas article. General Facts Staff: 8,350 Full time teachers: 4,144 Pupil to teacher ratio: 12 to 1 Teacher assistants (instructional aides): 1,011 Instructional Coordinators: 8 Elementary Teachers: 1,788 Kindergarten Teachers: 299 Pre-K Teachers: 166 High School Teachers: 1,458 Pre-K to 12 Students: 61,376 Financial Statistics for Aldine Independent School District Revenue Revenue from local sources: $194,063,000 Revenue from state sources: $273,834,000 Revenue from federal sources: $68,261,000 Total revenue: $536,158,000 Expenses Expenditures on instruction: $284,624,000 Expenditures on teacher salary: $340,767,000 Expenditures on teacher benefits: $46,420,000 Expenditures per student: $2,492,000 Total expenditures: $532,554,000 Breakdown of Teacher Salary Expenses Teacher salary expenses on regular education: $0 Teacher salary expenses on special education: $0 Teacher salary expenses on vocational education: $0 Information on Schools within Aldine Independent School District Elementary Schools within the Aldine Independent School District School Students Student to Teacher Ratio Full Time Certified Teachers Lowest Grade Offered Highest Grade Offered Anderson Academy
